x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Many essential medications, especially vaccines, insulin, and biologics, are temperature-sensitive and must be stored and transported within specific cold chain conditions. In remote or underserved areas, logistics infrastructure is limited, and power or refrigeration failures can compromise medicine quality often without being detected. Spoiled medications may be administered unknowingly, leading to ineffective treatment, adverse effects, and loss of public trust. There is a critical need for an automated, real-time system to detect, report, and respond to cold chain violations.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ColdChain AI is a ServiceNow-based AI-powered monitoring solution that integrates with IoT temperature sensors embedded in medicine storage units or transit containers.

Key features:

  • Sensors continuously send temperature and humidity data to ServiceNow via IntegrationHub
  • If thresholds are breached, AI Agent evaluates the risk level and automatically:
  • Notifies the assigned health worker or logistics coordinator
  • Suggests corrective actions (e.g., use backup storage, alert pharmacy)
  • Logs incidents for compliance reporting
  • AI Agent offers interactive guidance to workers on what to do in case of cold chain breach
  • Dashboards track trends, incidents, and cold chain stability across regions
  • This system ensures real-time protection and transparency of sensitive medical inventory.
  • AI Agent – Provides real-time alerts, decision support, and educational dialogue for staff
  • IntegrationHub – Connects with IoT platforms and sensor data streams
  • App Engine – For managing incident workflows, assets, and compliance logs
  • Flow Designer – Automates response actions (e.g., escalations, resupply, deactivation)
  • Performance Analytics – Tracks cold chain breaches, response times, and operational trends
  • Asset Management – To manage cold storage units, containers, and medicine stock locations

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • IoT temperature and humidity sensors with API access or data streams
  • Connectivity in rural areas (alternatives may include offline buffering and delayed sync)
  • Cold chain standard guidelines for reference (WHO, UNICEF, etc.)
  • Language support in AI Agent for global teams (optional)

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Inconsistent connectivity or power supply in remote areas
  • Variation in sensor hardware or data formats across partners
  • Ensuring accurate thresholds and configurations for different medication types
  • Training staff on interpreting alerts and using the AI Agent
  • Budget constraints for widespread sensor deployment in some NGOs
